by ak_spook on November 4th, 2009
That's simply not true. With three kids and being on the go often, I can (and do) come up with healthy options at MOST fast food places. Since you mentioned subs, Subway has at least eight 6"subs which contain 230-370 calories, 3-6g of fat (no trans fat), and 44-59g carbs. Each (except the veggie sub) is quite filling, a great source of lean protein, and well within proper parameters for being considered a healthy meal--no where near exceeding a recommended daily total (even for a shorty like me). Ideally, you *should* eat every 2-4 hours for optimal nutrition and metabolic advantage. Most people don't eat often enough and then make unhealthy choices. All things in moderation ak ;)

by ak_spook on November 8th, 2009
Whoa, who said you are not supposed to eat more than 1000 calories?! That is less than the daily maintenance for me to maintain my small frame with no activity. I need to eat at least 1500 calories just to keep up with my basic bodily functions. On 1700-2000 calories I can lose 2 lbs a week with proper food choices and activity. Trying to stick to an arbitrary 1000 calorie diet is exactly why so many people fail at proper nutrition and weight loss. Good choices MOST of the time is what works...proper nutrition consistently...with'treats'in moderation.

by Lady Alathia of Vulcan on November 2nd, 2009
I think the information should be available if asked, but I don't think they should have to scrawl it on the walls in neon lighting.
A posted link to an informational website is sufficient, in my opinion. The site should also include the restaurant's ingredients and some information about preparation (meat is heated to X degrees, etc).
